description: Lyric poems -- short, occasional pieces composed in various meters, often concerned with love
and longing -- are the focus of this Latin course. Students read the vivacious verse of
Catullus, Horace, Tibullus and Ovid and learn to recognize the features that make lyric a
distinctive genre of Latin poetry. Prerequisite: Latin 231 or equivalent. GE: FOL-L. Offered
